DOCNAME: CASE OF DE SANTA v. ITALY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . Mr PERSON GPE is the secretary of the municipal welfare agency ( ORG ) of the city of GPE , where he lives .

CARDINAL . On DATE he applied to the Friuli - Venezia Giulia ORG ( “ the RAC ” ) for judicial review of a decision of his employer ’s board of governors , which , on DATE , in adopting the staff regulations , had assigned to him a level of remuneration lower than that to which he considered himself to be entitled on the basis of the collective agreements on contracts of employment negotiated at national level by the unions concerned ( accordi nazionali di lavoro del personale degli enti locali ) . He also contested the discrimination between himself and other employees , who were paid on the basis of the salary scales laid down in the contracts in question .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ordered the municipal welfare agency to file certain documents . In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE , the text of which was deposited with the registry on CARDINAL DATE , it dismissed the applicant ’s application as being ill - founded .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr ORG appealed to the Consiglio di Stato . On DATE ORG , which had by then succeeded the municipal welfare agency , lodged a counter - appeal . It contended , as a preliminary point , that the applicant ’s appeal was inadmissible for failure to comply with the time - limit ; as regards the merits , it argued that the appeal should be dismissed as being ill - founded .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed an application for a date to be fixed for the hearing . On CARDINAL DATE he requested that the case be set down for an urgent hearing . In a judgment of DATE , the text of which was deposited with the registry on CARDINAL DATE , the PERSON dismissed the objection of inadmissibility and dismissed the applicant ’s appeal .
